args.query: sequence of compact subsets of open set in complex plane exhaustion by compacts with nested interiors closed disks cover

result: {"ok": true, "results": [{"id": 295446, "informal_statement": "For a topological space $X$, a countable index set $\\iota$, a family of sets $s : \\iota \\to \\mathcal{P}(X)$, and a doubly indexed family of compact sets $K : \\iota \\times \\mathbb{N} \\to \\mathcal{P}(X)$, suppose for every $i \\in \\iota$ and $n \\in \\mathbb{N}$, $K(i, n)$ is compact. Moreover, assume that for each $i \\in \\iota$, the union of $K(i, n)$ over all $n \\in \\mathbb{N}$ equals $s(i)$. Given that the union over $

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set Metric

lemma exists_compact_exhaustion_of_open_set_with_closed_disks (U : Set ℂ) (hU : IsOpen U) :
  ∃ K : ℕ → Set ℂ,
    (∀ n, IsCompact (K n)) ∧
    (∀ n, K n ⊆ interior (K (n+1))) ∧
    (U = ⋃ n, interior (K n)) ∧
    (∀ n, ∃ (S : Finset (ℂ × ℝ)),
       K n ⊆ (⋃ p ∈ (S : Set (ℂ × ℝ)), Metric.closed_ball p.1 p.2) ∧
       (⋃ p ∈ (S : Set (ℂ × ℝ)), Metric.closed_ball p.1 p.2) ⊆ interior (K (n+1)))
:= by sorry
